short_summary: stage 2 for the replacement of two (2) culverts in elk island national park
description: parks canada requires the replacement of two culverts within elk island national park (einp) located in alberta, canada. The first culvert is the hayburger culvert and the second is the beaver pond culvert. Each culvert is a galvanized rigid steel pipe and requires full replacement. The procurement will be done on a two-stage selection process. only qualified suppliers have been invited to bid.
full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement**

**Notice ID**: cb-216-23167168

**Title (English)**: Stage 2 - Culvert Replacements - Elk Island National Park

**Title (French)**: Phase 2 - Remplacement de Ponceaux - Parc national Elk Island

**Program Information**

* **Contracting Entity**: Parks Canada
* **Contracting Entity Address**: 145 McDermot Avenue, Winnipeg, Manitoba R3B 0R9, Canada
* **Contracting Entity Contact**: Kelly Nuevo, kelly.nuevo@pc.gc.ca, 204-430-7356
* **Notice Type**: Request for Proposal (RFP)

**Procurement Details**

* **Tender Closing Date**: June 27, 2024, 16:00:00
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: May 13, 2024
* **Expected Contract End Date**: October 4, 2024
* **Procurement Category**: Consulting and Advisory Services (CNST)
* **Authority**: Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC)
* **Trade Agreements**: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

**Supply and Service Requirements**

Parks Canada invites qualified suppliers to submit a financial bid for the replacement of two (2) culverts within Elk Island National Park (EINP). The culverts are located along the Elk Island Parkway and their replacement is required to ensure safe and reliable access to the park.

**Culvert Replacement Details**

* **Culvert Location 1**: Hayburger Culvert, located at 53°37'53" N, 112°51'28" W
* **Culvert Location 2**: Beaver Pond Culvert, located at 53°41'20" N, 112°48'40" W
* **Culvert Requirements**: Full replacement of the existing galvanized, rigid steel pipes

**Selection Criteria**

The selection process will be based on a two-stage evaluation. Stage One will assess the qualifications of all interested suppliers, while Stage Two invites qualified suppliers to provide further qualifications and a financial bid. Only qualified suppliers will be invited to bid.

**Attachments and Reference Documents**

None.
